person.persName: Junius R. Ward (Very wealthy Washington County, MS planter)

body.p: Residence: Washington County, Mississippi. Born in Georgetown, Scott County, Kentucky, son of William Ward and Sarah Johnson. One of the first white planters in the Mississippi Delta. Junius R. Ward moved from Scott County, Kentucky to Washington County, Mississippi in c1822. Established one of the largest plantations in Mississippi, called "Kentucky Bend," on Lake Washington. One of the wealthiest planters in the South. Also became extremely wealthy from cotton, hemp, mercantile, and shipping interests. Married Matilda Viley on August 28, 1824. Ward also built a mansion a mile west of Georgetown, Kentucky, in 1857. Lost much of his wealth as a result of the Civil War.
